intro: Schaefferia elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leaf schaefferia, is a perennial plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowering period occurs in late winter to early spring, producing white or pale blue blooms. Schaefferia elliptica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
